Wool/role.go.description: Package documentation convention: Two-line format - first line is synopsis (// Package name description.), second line explains naming metaphor (// Wool is the raw material that becomes agents - defining WHAT an agent IS.)

Yarn/message.go.description: Type hierarchy: Message is atomic unit with optional *HiddenState. HiddenState is the "boundary object" containing semantic state before text projection (Vector typically 2048-8192 float32 values).

Weaver/pkg/analysis/client.go.description: Package documentation style: First line synopsis, second line contextualizes purpose. Type comments start with type name and explain purpose. Method comments start with function name.

Yarn/session.go.description: Type hierarchy: Session contains []*Conversation and []*Measurement. Session is the top-level container for research. MeasurementMode can be passive, active, or triggered.

Yarn/conversation.go.description: Type hierarchy: Conversation contains []*Message and tracks Participants. Thread-safe with sync.RWMutex. Messages can be filtered by HasHiddenState().

Yarn/measurement.go.description: Measurement captures conveyance metrics: DEff (effective dimensionality), Beta (collapse indicator), Alignment (cosine similarity), CPair (bilateral conveyance). BetaStatus categorizes quality (optimal, monitor, concerning, critical).
